intro: Michelia linyaoensis, commonly known as the Linyao michelia, is a rare and ornamental evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes many ancient and fragrant flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is found in botanical gardens and conservation programs. Due to its limited natural range and habitat destruction, it is considered a vulnerable species.
